‚è∞ Scott Redler‚Äôs #630club - LIVE Premarket Stock Update $NVDA $TSLA $AMZN $SPY  ‚û°Ô∏è FREE NEWSLETTER: t3live.com/show nitter.net/i/broadcasts/1RDGlABDq‚Ä¶

$TSLA just unveiled ‚ÄúMegablock,‚Äù a pre-engineered 20 MWh AC energy storage unit with a 25-year life, 91% efficiency, and faster, cheaper installation. 

The new platform will be built at 50 GWh per year starting H2 2026. Based on Tesla‚Äôs past energy revenues, that output could translate to ~$14B in annual sales with ~30% margins, or around $4B in yearly profit from what‚Äôs already its most profitable segment. 

Deliveries kick off in 2026, adding serious scale to Tesla‚Äôs energy storage business

Goldman Sachs on $NBIS (Buy, PT $77):

"We view the Microsoft deal as a significant catalyst for Nebius' AI Infrastructure business, driving topline growth in its GPU-as-a-Service offering. Moreover, we believe that through this deal Nebius has shown that it can work with AI hyperscalers, especially given the size of the deal, which implies trust in Nebius's ability to scale; as such, we think this could potentially open the way to further large contacts. The scale of the agreement and associated financing flexibility should enable Nebius to accelerate capacity expansion beyond the company's own prior expectations, in our view. We believe that the cash flows from this deal could help with the required buildout, while also assuming some prepayment and Nebius' ability to finance rest of the Microsoft buildout with debt. We note that the company highlighted that the economics of the deal are attractive in their own right, implying good GMs, while the deal will also help Nebius to accelerate the growth of their AI cloud business even further in 2026 and beyond."

Analyst: Alexander Duval
